summary: This bill, the Building Resilient Infrastructure and Communities for All Act of 2025 (H.R. 4560), amends the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act to modify funding for predisaster hazard mitigation projects. Key changes include revising how funds are allocated, changing eligibility requirements for states and local governments, and setting a minimum funding amount for Indian tribal governments. It establishes a formula for distributing funds based on equal shares, population, and vulnerability to natural hazards. The bill also clarifies how the receipt of funds under this section impacts eligibility for other hazard mitigation assistance.
